plugins.name: Simple Task Creator
plugins.description: This plugin allows you to create custom visual frames to organize and represent tasks clearly and effectively. Each task is displayed within a frame that changes color automatically based on the selected task type, enabling quick and easy identification. You can also assign a title and description to each task, providing a detailed view within an attractive and organized visual environment. This plugin is perfect for improving task management and optimizing visual communication in collaborative projects.
plugins.tagline: Create simple tasks selecting between types

plugins.name: Design Library Showcase Generator by Precocity
plugins.description:
This plugin allows designers to effortlessly create a comprehensive showcase of their design components and all their various permutations within Figma.


Tailored for efficiency and customization, it provides users with some basic settings to adjust the appearance of their showcase page, including background colors, frame spacings, corner radii, and more. With options to show or hide variants, instance properties, and descriptions, this plugin simplifies the process of organizing and presenting your design library to clients, designers, and developers.


Ideal for designers looking to streamline their workflow and present their components in a visually appealing and organized manner without having to manually create each variation, it bridges the gap between design creation and presentation, enhancing both productivity and clarity.

plugins.name: ÁîªÊùøjsonÂØºÂá∫ Export Frame JSON
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin is designed to help users export detailed JSON data of selected nodes, including auto layout information, Frame nesting relationships, text properties, and more. With this plugin, users can easily retrieve structured data from design elements, facilitating data analysis, secondary development, or documentation.


ÂäüËÉΩ

  1. Export complete JSON data of selected nodes, including properties like type, name, size, position, fills, strokes, and more.
  2. Support exporting text content, font name, font size, and other properties of text nodes.
  3. Support nested export of nodes such as Frame, Group, Component, and Instance, preserving the full hierarchical structure.
  4. Complete export of auto layout information, including layout mode, primary and secondary axis alignment, padding, and spacing.
  5. Safely serialized JSON data export ensures compatibility and completeness.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select one or more nodes from which you want to export data.
  2. Click the export button in the plugin, and the plugin will automatically extract all relevant information from the selected nodes and generate JSON data.
  3. The exported JSON data will be displayed in the plugin interface, allowing users to copy or download it for further use.


Notes

  1. This plugin currently supports exporting properties of common node types such as Frame.
  2. Ensure that the selected node types are supported by the plugin; otherwise, related data might not be exportable.
  3. If errors occur during the export process, check whether the nodes contain excessive nesting or complex properties. Simplify the structure if needed and try again.

plugins.name: Wireframeit Plugin
plugins.description:
Transform live websites and HTML into fully editable designs or low-fidelity wireframes. Wireframeit accurately captures the layout, typography, and structure of any site and converts it into editable design files ready to export directly to Figma.


Use the browser extension to scan a live website, export it as a .wfit file, and import it into Figma using this plugin. You'll get clean frames, layout structure, and text boxes, no screenshots, no messy code.


How to use it:

  1. Install the Wireframeit browser extension.
  2. Click the extension on any website ‚Üí Export ‚Üí Figma.
  3. Download the .wfit file.
  4. Open Figma ‚Üí run the Wireframeit plugin.
  5. Drag in the file, hit Import, and start editing.
plugins.tagline: Convert any website into editable Figma designs or wireframes

plugins.name: Figma to Creght
plugins.description:
Export Figma to Creght

Copy, paste, and publish. Export your Figma designs by simply copying what's on the canvas and pasting it in Creght. This Figma to Creght plugin takes care of adapting your design to Creght‚Äôs layout tools in real time, so you can focus solely on making a great website.


How to use this plugin:

  1. Install the Free Figma plugin
  2. Copy your Figma designs
  3. Paste in Creght


How to better adapt responsive layouts:

  1. Always utilize Auto Layout whenever possible
  2. Prefer Fill/Hug over fixed dimensions for width/height


For more details, please visit https://www.creght.com/figma2creght

plugins.name: Batch Variable Customizer
plugins.description:
Batch update variables with ease ‚Äî across local and external libraries!


Effortlessly update multiple variables, including colors, aliases, or names, without the hassle of editing each one individually. This plugin streamlines variable management, allowing you to update color values, manage aliases, and rename entries seamlessly‚Äîwhether you're working with local collections or external libraries. Handle updates, deletions, and renaming in just a few clicks, regardless of the scale or complexity of your variables.


Features:

  1. Batch update color variables for both local and external libraries.
  2. Effortlessly rename multiple variables to maintain consistent naming conventions.
  3. Bulk delete variables for quick and efficient cleanup.


Braces notation for aliasing:

  1. For local libraries: {collectionName.variableName}
  2. For external libraries: {LibraryName/collectionName.variableName}

Use the / suggestion box to quickly browse and select variables from your libraries, ensuring precise and consistent aliasing.


Huge thanks to Jan Six for creating the Batch Styler plugin, which inspired this tool; currently supporting color variables, with plans to expand to other variable types in the future!


Limitations:

Due to Figma API constraints, updates to external libraries (such as changes to variable names, new collections, or modes) will not be automatically reflected in the plugin. To capture such updates, simply reload the Figma file, and the plugin will synchronize with the latest changes.


Questions & Support

This plugin is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions, please get in touch directly. I'll help you troubleshoot and resolve any issues as quickly as possible.
plugins.tagline: Batch update, rename, and delete variables effortlessly, including colors and aliases.

plugins.name: Thumbnail Setter
plugins.description:
Easily create thumbnails from almost any selection, without needing to manually wrap layers; in both Figma and FigJam.


Figma typically requires frames, components, component sets, or sections to create a thumbnail, but with Thumbnail Setter, you can select multiple layers or component instances, and the plugin will automatically frame them in the background before setting the thumbnail.


In FigJam, where only sections can typically be thumbnails, this plugin allows you to create thumbnails from any selection, even from instances directly within FigJam ‚Äì without needing to predefine them in Figma (which was the only workaround).


How to use in Figma:

  1. Select the layer(s) you want as a thumbnail.
  2. Press Cmd+K (Mac) or Ctrl+K (Windows) to open the Action menu.
  3. Switch to the Plugins & Widgets tab.
  4. Search for "Thumbnail Setter" and run it.


How to use in FigJam:

  1. Select the element(s) you want as a thumbnail.
  2. Press Shift+I to open the Insert panel.
  3. Switch to the Plugins tab.
  4. Search for "Thumbnail Setter" and run it.

From now on, you can also use Quick actions (Cmd+K or Ctrl+K).


Limitation: The plugin won‚Äôt work if you select multiple layers, including a section. However, single section selections work fine.


Feel free to share your feedback and help me make Thumbnail Setter even better!
plugins.tagline: Quickly convert any selection into a thumbnail, in both Figma and FigJam.

plugins.name: ConvertCase
plugins.description:
Convertcase lets you instantly convert text to Sentence case, lowercase, UPPER CASE, or Title Case directly within Figma. No more copy-paste or external tools needed!


Built with surprisingly basic coding and ChatGPT, Convertcase empowers you to focus on design, not case management.


Here's how it works:

  1. Select your text layer.
  2. Choose your desired case conversion from the Convertcase plugin menu.
  3. Boom! Your text is instantly transformed.


Save time and streamline your design workflow with Convertcase. Try it today!

plugins.name: Eternal Variable Export
plugins.description:
Export library variables, library styles, local variables and local styles to CSS variables and classes (for text and effect styles).


To export styles which are included in a library, you will need to go to the library file and copy the style keys from within the plugin, then go back to the file you are exporting from and paste the keys into the 'Include External Style Keys' input field. This is required because Figma does not make the styles accessibile within their APIs. Make sure your library has been published when exporting styles to ensure the output includes the changes.


Alternatively export as JSON and write your own scripts to convert into any style format you need.


Todo:

  • Make it clearer how to include external styles
  • Support additional export modes (e.g. scss)

70194.description:
Export library variables, library styles, local variables and local styles to CSS variables and classes (for text and effect styles).


To export styles which are included in a library, you will need to go to the library file and copy the style keys from within the plugin, then go back to the file you are exporting from and paste the keys into the 'Include External Style Keys' input field. This is required because Figma does not make the styles accessibile within their APIs. Make sure your library has been published when exporting styles to ensure the output includes the changes.


Alternatively export as JSON and write your own scripts to convert into any style format you need.

plugins.name: Circle Packing
plugins.description:
Packing circles with random sizes in a given shape.


Please try the tutorial below first


Tutorial

  1. Create a Frame with a white background and set its size to 400 x 400.
  2. Draw a black circle (#000000) with a size of 300 x 300, centered within the frame.
  3. Open the plugin and make sure the Mask Color is black (#000000)
  4. Select the Frame and click "Generate."
  5. Adjust the settings and enjoy!


Input Settings

  1. Mask Color: The part inside the frame where circles can be generated inside.
  2. Filter Quality: (0 - 100%) In a large Frame, reducing filter quality will help it generate faster.


Output Settings

  1. Num of Circles: (1 - 10,000) The maximum number of circles that can be generated.
  2. Circle Color: The color of the generated circles.
  3. Min. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The smallest radius for the generated circles.
  4. Max. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The largest radius for the generated circles. If the minimum and maximum values differ, each circle's radius will be randomly chosen between these two values.
  5. Padding Radius: (0 - 10,000) The extra radius (space) between circles to prevent them from overlapping.
  6. Bias: (0 - 10,000) When set to 0, circles have an equal chance to be any size between the minimum and maximum. When set to 1 or higher, circles will tend to be either very large (first) or very small (if it cannot fit).
  7. Num of Attempts: (1 - 1000) The number of tries to add circles. For example, if the number of circles is set to 500 and attempts are set to 5, the plugin will try to generate 500 circles. If the first attempt fails, it will try up to 5 times. This means it will try up to 2,500 times or stop once 500 circles are successfully created.


Pricing

  1. 10 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access and future updates for a one-time purchase.
plugins.tagline: Generate Random Circles inside Given Shape

plugins.name: Variables Exporter For Dev Mode
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to extract a comprehensive JSON representation of all the variables used within a Figma document. This JSON output can serve as a foundation for transforming design variables into cross-platform design tokens‚Äîfor example, generating Tailwind CSS classes or integrating them into a design token pipeline like Style Dictionary.


The exported format is intentionally rich and flexible, enabling developers to write custom scripts or transformations as needed. However, the plugin also offers two configuration options that reduce the need for manual preprocessing‚Äîsaving time and making integration into developer workflows more seamless:


Resolve Aliases


When enabled, this option resolves all aliases to their final, underlying values. The plugin supports cascading resolution, meaning it can follow chains of aliases until it reaches a concrete value.


A key feature here is the smart handling of multi-mode variable collections. If variables are connected through multi-mode collections, the plugin attempts to match modes based on slugified mode names. If no match is found, the target collection‚Äôs default mode is used instead.


Importantly, the resolution is always based on the original mode name‚Äînot the fallback.


Example:


The variable primary in the light mode of the semantics collection points to the variable blue in the primitives collection (which only contains the dark mode). That variable in turn points to blue-500 in the palettes collection, which contains both light and dark modes. In this case, resolution ultimately lands on blue-500 in the light mode, even though the intermediate blue variable belongs to a dark-only collection.


Exclude Hidden Variables


This option filters out any variables that have the "Hide from publishing" checkbox enabled in Figma.


When aliases are involved, any variable pointing to a hidden variable will still follow the alias resolution rules described above. This ensures that the exported JSON always contains usable and resolved values, even if some variables are marked as hidden in the Figma UI.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to JSON-based format

plugins.name: Spreadsheet to Figma
plugins.description:
Sync content from Google Sheets directly into your Figma file.


Step 1

Prepare your figma design. Aptly name your layers, cause they will be referenced by name in your spreadsheet!


Step 2

Prepare your google spreadsheet:

  1. reserve first row for headings
  2. each row will be a copy of the design


Each column name should be: layer_name.layer_property (examples: rectangle.fill, client.text)


Available properties:

  1. x : number
  2. y : number
  3. width : number
  4. height: number
  5. rotation: number
  6. fill : image url or hex color
  7. instance : component name
  8. text: string
  9. stroke_weight: number
  10. stroke_color: hex color


Step 3

Make the spreadsheet public and copy the url


Step 4

  1. Open the plugin
  2. Paste the url
  3. Select the layer
  4. Smash that big orange button!


For support

Hit bbtgnn.net!
plugins.tagline: Easily merge spreadsheet data with any selection

plugins.name: Ollama Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Ollama Auto Fill


Before Use:

Please install and run Ollama according to my tutorial:


  1. Tutorial: document
  2. For more information, please visit my official website: https://figma.comfyui.asia


Description

Ollama Auto Fill is a powerful Figma plugin that leverages the Ollama local large language model to automatically generate and fill text content. Designed specifically for designers, this tool can quickly generate multiple unique text items and automatically populate them into selected Figma text components, significantly enhancing design efficiency.


Key Features

‚Ä¢ Generate high-quality text using the Ollama local large language model

‚Ä¢ Support batch generation of multiple unique text items

‚Ä¢ Automatically fill generated text into selected Figma text components

‚Ä¢ Clean and intuitive user interface for easy operation

‚Ä¢ Real-time selection updates and error prompts for a smooth user experience


How It Works

1. Install the Ollama Auto Fill plugin in Figma

2. Ensure the local Ollama service is running (default address: http://localhost:11434)

3. Select one or more text components in your Figma design

4. Run the Ollama Auto Fill plugin

5. Enter your prompt in the plugin interface

6. Click the "Generate Text" button

7. Wait for text generation to complete, and the generated text will automatically fill the selected text components


Why Use Ollama Auto Fill?

‚Ä¢ Save time: Quickly generate realistic and contextually appropriate text content

‚Ä¢ Enhance creativity: Get inspired by AI-generated text for your designs

‚Ä¢ Improve workflow: Seamlessly integrate text generation into your Figma design process

‚Ä¢ Maintain privacy: Utilize a local language model for data security


Requirements

‚Ä¢ Figma desktop app

‚Ä¢ Locally installed and running Ollama service (default address: http://localhost:11434)


Notes

‚Ä¢ Ensure the Ollama service is running locally and accessible

‚Ä¢ The plugin requires at least one text component to be selected to generate text

‚Ä¢ The number of generated text items will match the number of selected text components


Ollama Auto Fill streamlines your design process by providing instant, high-quality text content. Try it now and experience the power of local AI-assisted text generation in your Figma designs!
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin that uses the Ollama local language model to auto-generate and fill text

plugins.name: Lines to frames
plugins.description:
This simple plugin converts text lines from a selected normal Figma text frame to regular frames of defined pixel size with or without text. Optionally generated frames can be wrapper to an auto layout. Frames are named according to the lines.


This is helpful for example when you have a list of file names and you know you want to create a frames for each with defined size.


I'm not aware of any limits regarding how many lines are supported or how big frames.
plugins.tagline: Converts lines from text frame to frames of any size with or without text.

plugins.name: Apply Absolute Auto Layout
plugins.description:
Apply Absolute Auto Layout


Have you ever applied auto layout to an icon frame, only for it to resize the frame and reposition the vectors inside of it? Here is the solution to your auto layout woes!


This plugin applies the following to each selected frame:


  1. Set auto layout, center alignment on both axes, fixed width and height, and restore original frame dimensions
  2. For each immediate vector child layer, apply absolute positioning and restore original x/y coordinates within the parent frame


And that's it!


GitHub Repository: https://github.com/Saeris/apply-absolute-auto-layout
plugins.tagline: Apply autolayout to your icons without risk of resizing or elements repositioning!

Wide Language Support: Offering translations in over 70 languages, the Apployal Localize plugin ensures your app resonates with users worldwide.

Effortless Localization of Media Assets: Easily translate app icons, screenshots for app store pages, ad creatives, and other media directly in Figma, saving time and streamlining your workflow.

Tailored for wide users range: Whether you're a designer fine-tuning app visuals, app owner that want expand global reach, or marketer creating localized ad campaigns, this plugin simplifies your work without the need for external translation tools or services.


Google Play and App Store integration:

Get Started Today:


Step into the world of efficient and effective app localization with the Apployal Localize Figma Plugin. Expand your app's global reach with localized visuals that speak directly to your audience, no matter where they are.


Note:

This plugin requires account of Apployal Localize.


24/7 Support:


Our dedicated support team is always on hand to assist you with any questions or help you might need in navigating app localization with our Figma plugin.


Contact us

plugins.name: Digital Wellbeing Lens
plugins.description:
Plugin made for research purposes at Politecnico di Torino.


This plugin helps to design better applications relatively to digital wellbeing.


How to use it:

  1. Open the plugin and insert your OpenAI API key.
  2. Select one or multiple designed screen and click on "Scan" to receive the report for each screen, which consists on the list of detected design patterns relevant for digital wellbeing.
  3. Flag a design pattern as incorrectly detected if you think the system is wrong.
  4. Try to use the suggested solutions present in the report to correct your design, and when you feel satisfied run a new scan.
  5. Re-iterate whenever you feel like you need some suggestions on how much you are aligned with digital wellbeing design guidelines.
plugins.tagline: Check your design for patterns damaging to digital wellbeing

plugins.name: ColorAura - Enhanced Shade Generator
plugins.description:
ColorAura - Enhanced Shade Generator


ColorAura turns the creation of color shades into an exact science. Using a mathematically calibrated super elliptic curve, the plugin generates professional color scales that can be customized to fit any project's needs.


Key features:

  1. Create hues based on a super elliptic curve for smooth and natural transitions
  2. Full integration with Figma Variables for a systematic approach to color
  3. Non-linear distribution for more precise gradation control
  4. Automatic text adaptation (black/white) depending on background brightness
  5. Intuitive interface with real-time visual previews


Customization for your needs:

Take full control of your color scales with adjustable super ellipse settings and distribution types. Choose between linear and step distributions, include white and black colors in your palette, or create variable-free palettes for rapid prototyping. The possibilities are endless.


Working with variables:

ColorAura seamlessly integrates with Figma Variables, automatically creating and organizing color variables into a clean, hierarchical structure. Each shade gets a meaningful name in the format "ColorName/Percent", making them intuitive to use across your design system.


Questions and Support:

For suggestions, bug reports, or general feedback, please reach out through the Figma Community or connect with me on social media (@ninsent). Your input helps make ColorAura better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Superelliptic curve-based generator for perfect tints & shades

plugins.name: Transparency Reference Legend
plugins.description: The Transparency Reference Legend plugin for Figma is designed to help designers create a clear visual reference for color transparencies. With an intuitive interface, users can select a base color and specify the number of transparency levels to generate. The plugin then produces a series of shapes within a frame, each displaying the selected color with different transparency levels. Users have the flexibility to customize the size and spacing of the shapes, as well as choose the frame orientation (horizontal or vertical). This tool is ideal for designers who want to explore and document color transparencies in their projects, providing a useful reference legend for design consistency.
plugins.tagline: Easily Create and Display Color Transparencies with the Transparency Reference Legend

plugins.name: Modyo Color Palette
plugins.description:
The Modyo Color Palette Generator is a powerful tool designed to help you create comprehensive color palettes in the Modyo style. This plugin not only generates a series of tints and shades based on a selected base color but also provides crucial contrast information to ensure accessibility compliance.


Features:


  • Color Picker: Easily select your base color using a convenient color picker.
  • Color Variations: Generate a palette with multiple shades and tints from your base color.
  • Accessibility Compliance: Automatically calculate and display contrast ratios for each color against white and black backgrounds. The plugin also indicates whether each color meets AAA or AA standards for large and small text as well as graphics.
  • Hex Codes and Identifiers: View the hex codes and identifiers (e.g., color-25, color-50) for each generated color.


How to Use:


  • Open the Plugin: Launch the Modyo Color Palette Generator from your Figma plugins menu.
  • Enter Color Details: Input a color name and select your base color using the color picker.
  • Generate Palette: Click the "Generate Palette" button to create a comprehensive palette.
  • Review Results: The plugin will display a vertical layout of the generated colors, each with its hex code, identifier, and contrast ratio details.


Limitations:


  • Single Base Color: The palette is generated based on a single base color. For multiple base colors, you need to run the plugin separately for each color.
  • Static Contrast Values: The contrast calculations are based on standard white and black backgrounds only.
  • Manual Adjustments: Any additional adjustments to the generated palette must be done manually in Figma.


This plugin is an essential tool for designers looking to maintain color consistency and accessibility in their projects, ensuring that all color choices are both aesthetically pleasing and compliant with accessibility standards.
plugins.tagline: Generate Modyo-style color palettes with AAA/AA contrast
